citations.narrative:
The Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) presented at time of inspection did not have a plan for vaccinating for Parvo-
Distemper for adult dogs, mention the sampling and treatment of parasites (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia and
heartworm) nor did it include a schedule for their sampling. It did not mention a schedule for when preventative care and
treatment (including eyes, skin, teeth, and nails) would occur.
An appropriate PVC must include a plan to vaccinate for Parvo-Distemper, sampling for parasites, and include a
preventative care plan. An appropriate PVC must be developed and followed to ensure the health and well-being of the
dogs.
The applicant must add to the PVC: a plan for vaccinating for Paro-Distemper, a plan for having the dogs sampled for
parasites, and a schedule for preventative care. The applicant must also have available documentation to demonstrate
that the PVC is being followed.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by September 8th, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License
Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) presented at time of inspection did not have a plan for vaccinating for Parvo-
Distemper for adult dogs, mention the sampling and treatment of parasites (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia and 
heartworm) nor did it include a schedule for their sampling. It did not mention a schedule for when preventative care and 
treatment (including eyes, skin, teeth, and nails) would occur.  
An appropriate PVC must include a plan to vaccinate for Parvo-Distemper, sampling for parasites, and include a 
preventative care plan. An appropriate PVC must be developed and followed to ensure the health and well-being of the 
dogs.  
The applicant must add to the PVC: a plan for vaccinating for Paro-Distemper, a plan for having the dogs sampled for 
parasites, and a schedule for preventative care. The applicant must also have available documentation to demonstrate 
that the PVC is being followed. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by September 8th, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the 
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License 
Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
